verdict.summary: AbortController signal triggered. Intentional timeout or cancellation.

dead_ends.why_fails: AbortController was added for a reason — removing it may cause resource leaks

dead_ends.action: Increase timeout to a very large value
dead_ends.why_fails: May cause resource exhaustion if operations genuinely hang

workarounds.action: Increase the timeout if it's too aggressive: AbortSignal.timeout(30000)
Handle the AbortError in catch block — it's expected behavior for cancellation
workarounds.how: try { await fetch(url, { signal }) } catch(e) { if (e.name === 'AbortError') { /* timeout */ } }

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'AbortError' indicates an aborted async operation, while 'ReferenceError' indicates a reference to an undefined variable.
